item.title: Raquel add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "My brain? That's my second favorite organ." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "It's not my brain that's writing the book, it's these hands of mine." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Robert Anton Wilson
item.description: "...when dogma enters the brain, all intellectual activity ceases. " -- Robert Anton Wilson

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Charlotte Perkins Gilman
item.description: "There is no female mind. The brain is not an organ of sex. As well speak of a female liver." -- Charlotte Perkins Gilman

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Jeffrey Eugenides
item.description: "Biology gives you a brain. Life turns it into a mind." -- Jeffrey Eugenides

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "I am as bad as the worst, but, thank God, I am as good as the best. " -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I don't know the question, but sex is definitely the answer." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Raquel add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Why should we take advice on sex from the pope? If he knows anything about it, he shouldn't!" -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Writing is like sex. First you do it for love, then you do it for your friends, and then you do it for money." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "But now and then, a woman walks up, full blossom, a woman just bursting out of her dressâ€¦a sex creature, a curse, the end of it all." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Sex is kicking death in the ass while singing." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "When one door of happiness closes, another opens; but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Knowledge is love and light and vision." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Literature is my Utopia" -- Helen Keller

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Ludwig Wittgenstein
item.description: "The limits of my language means the limits of my world." -- Ludwig Wittgenstein

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Thus inevitably does the universe wear our color, and every object fall successively into the subject itself. The subject exists, the subject enlarges; all things sooner or later fall into place. As I am, so I see; use what language we will, we can never say anything but what we are." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "War is what happens when language fails." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Raquel add a quote by W. H. Auden
item.description: "As a poet, there is only one political duty, and that is to defend one's language from corruption." -- W. H. Auden

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Italo Calvino
item.description: "I have tried to remove weight, sometimes from people, sometimes from heavenly bodies, sometimes from cities; above all I have tried to remove weight from the structure of stories and from language." -- Italo Calvino

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Harryette Mullen
item.description: "Poetry is language playing with itself." -- Harryette Mullen

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Dennis Potter
item.description: "The trouble with words is that you never know whose mouths they've been in." -- Dennis Potter

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Wade Davis
item.description: "Language is an old-growth forest of the mind." -- Wade Davis

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Christopher Morley (1890 - 1957)
item.description: "Life is a foreign language; all men mispronounce it. " -- Christopher Morley (1890 - 1957)

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is hard enough to remember my opinions, without also remembering my reasons for them!" -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Raquel add a quote by Howard Gardner
item.description: "I want my children to understand the world, but not just because the world is fascinating and the human mind is curious. I want them to understand it so that they will be positioned to make it a better place" -- Howard Gardner
